issue_description:
# No way to see which state an issue was opened for on the main feed page. 

On the test server, I noticed that when creating a new thread we can select which state a thread is for, but our thread cards don't this information. We should probably add this information to the card.

golden_answers_generated: The issue discusses the lack of visibility of the state for which an issue was opened on the main feed page. It suggests that this information should be added to the thread cards to improve clarity.
The proposed change is to add information about the state for which a thread was opened to the thread cards on the main feed page, enabling users to see this detail at a glance.
The outdated requirement mentioned was obtaining a Sunlight API key, as Sunlight Foundation no longer offers their API. The current alternative being worked on is migrating to the ProPublica API.

Developers should try to skip the step requiring the Sunlight API key, as the migration to the ProPublica API is a work-in-progress. They should also check for any errors that arise due to this and address them accordingly.

Testing confirmed that both the test and release versions allow state selection when creating a new thread, implying that the issue regarding thread card visibility should be closed as it has been resolved.
